result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald D McLemore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision: Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); All applicable fees of supervision. Cash bail applied. If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work. Court stayed commencement until 01-22-16 by 5pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald D McLemore

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gerald D McLemore
Current: 2551 N. 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206-2054 United States  (Effective: 04-11-2016)
Prior: 4107 West Meinecke Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 8 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 4 MONTHS condition time with Huber for work.  Court stayed commencement until 01/22/2016 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.  
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Filed: Voting Rights  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Jane Christopherson for Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Christian Lindo for Jane Heather Christopherson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Christian Lindo for Jane Heather Christopherson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to obtain discovery and review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel received and filed.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Magana informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Off the record Court vacated the jury trial date of 09/08/2015.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Gerald D McLemore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/20/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 9/8/2015 at 9:00 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore not in court, defendant in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Atty is ill on todays date. Case rescheduled for Return on Warrant on 7/6/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Sergio Magana in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered cash bail forfeited. Court vacates trial date.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 7/15/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense just received discovery. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/7/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gerald D McLemore in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
